title: Appian Shares Rise After 2Q Revenue Beat
description: Appian Shares Rise After 2Q Revenue Beat
content:
Appian shares were 17% higher after the company reported second-quarter revenue that beat analysts' expectations.

Revenue for the quarter was $170.6 million, compared with last year's $146.5 million and the $160.4 million analysts were expecting.

The software company said it had a quarterly loss of $312,000, or 0 cents a share, compared with a loss of $43.6 million, or 60 cents a share, in the same quarter last year. Analysts polled by FactSet were looking for a loss of $21 million, or 29 cents a share.

The company said cloud subscriptions revenue was 21% higher at $106.9 million, and professional services revenue was $38 million, up 13% compared with last year.

Adjusted earnings were flat, compared with the loss of 13 cents analysts had forecast.

For the third quarter, Appian expects revenue to be $172 million to $176 million, while analysts are looking for revenue of $160.4 million. The company is also looking for 2025 adjusted earnings of 3 cents to 7 cents a share. Analysts are forecasting adjusted EPS of 6 cents.

The company said it is expecting third-quarter cloud subscription revenue of $109 million to $111 million, representing year-over-year growth of 16% to 18%.

For 2025, Appian is expecting revenue of $695 million to $703, compared with the $682.1 million analysts are expecting. For 2025, the company is expecting adjusted earnings of 28 cents to 36 cents, while analysts are forecasting adjusted EPS of 22 cents.
